  <script type="text/javascript">
   function parentIsEvil(parent) {
					var html = null;
					try {
					  var doc = top.location.pathname;
					} catch(err){
					  // do nothing
					};
					return(doc != "/wp-admin/customize.php");
				};
				if (top.location != self.location &amp;&amp; parentIsEvil()) { 
					top.location = self.location.href;
				};
  </script>

           </div>
           <h2>
            <span id="Softaculous_WordPress_Installation">
             Softaculous WordPress Installation
            </span>
           </h2>
           <p>
            <img alt="4 Quick and Simple Softaculous WordPress Installation Security Tips" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4242" data-src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/4-Simple-Softaculous-WordPress-Installation-Security-Tips.png" height="512" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" width="1024"/>
           </p>
           <noscript>
            <img alt="4 Quick and Simple Softaculous WordPress Installation Security Tips" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4242" height="512" src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/4-Simple-Softaculous-WordPress-Installation-Security-Tips.png" width="1024"/>
           </noscript>
           <p>
            I recently
            <a href="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/social-blog-blueprint-review-part-1-blogging-course/" target="_blank" title="Social Blog Blueprint Review Part 1 (Is This Blogging Course for You?)">
             reviewed the Social Blog Blueprint
            </a>
            (it is a very good blogging course for beginner and intermediate bloggers). My main gripe was showing 1-click installation of WordPress. The course recommends installing WordPress via the Softaculous script. I did notice that Softaculous allows you to change some of the default WordPress settings  this is a good thing!
           </p>
           <p>
            So, I had a rummage around my cpanel for the Softaculous WordPress Install script and created this short video to complement my review of the Social Blog Blueprint. Theres a transcript below for those who prefer to read.
           </p>
           <h3>
            <span id="4_Simple_Softaculous_WordPress_Install_Security_Tips">
             4 Simple Softaculous WordPress Install Security Tips
            </span>
           </h3>
           <p>
            <iframe allowfullscreen="allowfullscreen" frameborder="0" height="360" src="//www.youtube.com/embed/p-zXfH8y-8Q?rel=0" width="640">
            </iframe>
            <br/>
            <strong>
             <div class="sh-link transcript-link sh-hide" id="transcript-link-4241">
              <a aria-expanded="false" href="#" onclick="showhide_toggle('transcript', 4241, 'Show Full Video Transcript', 'Hide Video Transcript'); return false;">
               <span id="transcript-toggle-4241">
                Show Full Video Transcript
               </span>
              </a>
             </div>
             <div class="sh-content transcript-content sh-hide" id="transcript-content-4241" style="display: none;">
              Hi, its Jan Kearney at My Local Business Online. In this video I want to show you a couple of quick ways you can improve the security of your WordPress install when using the Softaculous installation script. Ive been reviewing Sue and Dan Worthingtons new blogging course, the Social Blog Blueprint and it is actually a very good course. Its ideal for beginner and intermediate bloggers who want to start a business blog and use it as the core of their online visibility system and strategy. However, I did have niggles over the security issues with 1-click WordPress installs. I wanted to clarify what I mean in this video.
              <p>
               Its been a long time since I 1-clicked anything, I always manually install WordPress these days. Ive never used the Softaculous install script, so I really cant comment on it.
              </p>
              <p>
               There are a couple of places on it that I noticed where you can tighten up security just by changing the basic settings that they give you for the WordPress install.
              </p>
              <p>
               First off is the WordPress database name. In this case its wp82. I am assuming that these numbers are randomly generated, I dont know off hand. But I would change your database name to something that doesnt include the letters wp. It doesnt matter what you call it, just change it over.
              </p>
              <p>
               Most importantly is the table prefix. All WordPress installs come with the default table prefix of wp. What happens is, people who write these scripts to take advantage of your database know this. So theyre looking for this table prefix, or theyre often looking for this table prefix so change it. Dont make it easy for them. It doesnt matter what you change it to, just not wp. Make it random and unique to you.
              </p>
              <p>
               I would advise keeping the underscore because that separates the table name and it makes it easier to read if you ever have to go look at your tables. So change your table prefix to something thats unique to you. You can use 2-6 characters or so. Write it down somewhere safe so you know.
              </p>
              <p>
               Now Sue did mention in the Social Blog Blueprint about changing the admin username. Dont keep it as admin, neither have administrator nor for that matter your domain name. So in my case that would be mylocalbusinessonline. Because these people who try knocking on your front door and testing your password often use these logins as default often and will keep knocking trying to get in.
              </p>
              <p>
               I would also increase the security and strength of your password. 60 out of 100 is strong, but definitely go for the 100 out of 100. Thats about it, I hope that helps. Ill speak to you soon!
              </p>
             </div>
            </strong>
           </p>
           <h3>
            <span id="Quick_Softaculous_Install_Security_Tips">
             Quick Softaculous Install Security Tips
            </span>
           </h3>
           <p>
            1. Change the WordPress database name
            <br/>
            <img alt="change the WordPress database name" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4246" data-src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/change-the-database-name.png" height="66" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" width="1084"/>
           </p>
           <noscript>
            <img alt="change the WordPress database name" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4246" height="66" src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/change-the-database-name.png" width="1084"/>
           </noscript>
           <p>
            2. Change the table prefix
            <br/>
            <img alt="change wordpress table prefix" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4248" data-src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/change-wordpress-table-prefix.png" height="104" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" width="1126"/>
           </p>
           <noscript>
            <img alt="change wordpress table prefix" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4248" height="104" src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/change-wordpress-table-prefix.png" width="1126"/>
           </noscript>
           <p>
            3. Change the admin login name (Dont use admin, administrator nor your domain name)
            <br/>
            <img alt="change wordpress username and password" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4250" data-src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/change-wordpress-username-and-password1.png" height="173" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" width="1137"/>
           </p>
           <noscript>
            <img alt="change wordpress username and password" class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-4250" height="173" src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/change-wordpress-username-and-password1.png" width="1137"/>
           </noscript>
           <p>
            4. Strengthen your password
           </p>
           <p>
            While it is impossible to secure your WordPress install 100% (or any other website for that matter!) these 4 tips will make it much harder for people to compromise your site.
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Over to you
            </strong>
           </p>
           <p>
            How did you install your WordPress site? Have you ever been hacked? Share your experience in the comments!
           </p>
           <p>
            <strong>
             Dont forget to download your PDF
            </strong>
            :
            <a href="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/softaculous-wordpress-install-security-tips.pdf" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'download', 'http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/softaculous-wordpress-install-security-tips.pdf');" target="_blank">
             softaculous wordpress install security tips
            </a>
           </p>

        <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-70 photo" data-src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=70&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g" height="70" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=140&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g 2x" width="70"/>
        <noscript>
         <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-70 photo" height="70" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=70&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=140&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g 2x" width="70"/>
        </noscript>
        <h4 class="author-box-title">
         About
         <span itemprop="name">
          Jan Kearney
         </span>
        </h4>
        <div class="author-box-content" itemprop="description">
         <p>
          I believe that every business, no matter how small or how local can use the power of the web to gain more customers.  I offer no bull coaching and mentoring so small business owners can strategically put the web to work for their business.  I've been called a "compass" and a "navigator" and probably a few more names that aren't suitable for a profile!
          <br/>
          Connect with me on
          <a href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/+JanKearney">
           Google+
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="http://www.facebook.com/mylocalbusinessonline">
           Facebook
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="http://www.pinterest.com/mlbojan/">
           Pinterest
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

         </li>

         <li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="comment-5649">
          <article itemprop="comment" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/UserComments">
           <header class="comment-header">
            <p class="comment-author" itemprop="creator" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-48 photo" data-src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/68e5d9c7d7e1611e69eed3c6557f63ca?s=48&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g" height="48" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/68e5d9c7d7e1611e69eed3c6557f63ca?s=96&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g 2x" width="48"/>
            </p>
            <noscript>
             <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-48 photo" height="48" src="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/68e5d9c7d7e1611e69eed3c6557f63ca?s=48&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g" srcset="http://0.gravatar.com/avatar/68e5d9c7d7e1611e69eed3c6557f63ca?s=96&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g 2x" width="48"/>

            <span itemprop="name">
             <a class="comment-author-link" href="http://www.bonniegean.com/" itemprop="url" rel="external nofollow">
              Bonnie Gean
             </a>
            </span>
            <span class="says">
             says
            </span>
            <p class="comment-meta">
             <time class="comment-time" datetime="2014-10-03T05:43:54+00:00" itemprop="commentTime">
              <a class="comment-time-link" href="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/softaculous-wordpress-install-security/#comment-5649" itemprop="url">
               October 3, 2014 at 5:43 am
              </a>
             </time>
            </p>
           </header>
           <div class="comment-content" itemprop="commentText">
            <p>
             I remember when I did a video about WordPress installations and you flinched at the instructional video.
            </p>
            <p>
             Ever since then I dont tell people to use the CPANEL and FTP method to install the software manually!
            </p>
            <p>
             I believe it makes the installation much more secure  as you show in todays video!
            </p>
            <p>
             Thanks for the reminder!  I shall not forget.
             <img alt=":)" class="wp-smiley" src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-includes/images/smilies/simple-smile.png" style="height: 1em; max-height: 1em;"/>
             <br/>
             <span class="cluv">
              Bonnie Gean recently posted
              <a class="9e2a5fe406 5649 p" href="http://www.bonniegean.com/how-to-schmooze-with-local-business-owners/" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'http://www.bonniegean.com/how-to-schmooze-with-local-business-owners/', 'How to Schmooze with Local Business Owners');" rel="nofollow">

           <header class="comment-header">

             says
            </span>
            <p class="comment-meta">
             <time class="comment-time" datetime="2014-10-03T12:16:19+00:00" itemprop="commentTime">
              <a class="comment-time-link" href="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/softaculous-wordpress-install-security/#comment-5653" itemprop="url">
               October 3, 2014 at 12:16 pm
              </a>
             </time>
            </p>
           </header>
           <div class="comment-content" itemprop="commentText">
            <p>
             Great tutorial because we have to think about security more every day.  I had purchased some WP themes a while back that had security breach virus build right into them that my hosting company had to remove. Not fun, which is why I now test everything before I ever pass it along to someone else. Security hacker are really one of my biggest pet peeves.
             <br/>
             <span class="cluv">
              Denise recently posted
              <a class="aeeaa00dd7 5653" href="http://www.ideacow.com/plr-content-tips-start-recipe-blog/" onclick="__gaTracker('send', 'event', 'outbound-comment', 'http://www.ideacow.com/plr-content-tips-start-recipe-blog/', 'How to Start a Recipe Blog: PLR Photos, Content and Tips');" rel="nofollow">

              </a>

            </p>

       <section class="widget mab-widget" id="mab-widget-2">
        <div class="widget-wrap">
         <div class="mab-inside-wrap">
          <div class="magic-action-box mab-type-optin mab-id-3002 mabstyle-user userstyle-1 use-mab-button-default mab-label-position-stacked mab-responsive mab-fields-layout-stacked" data-mabid="3002" data-track="1" data-trackid="3002" data-type="optin" id="mab-30021">
           <div class="mab-pad mab-wrap mab-aside-left mab-aside-type-none">
            <div class="mab-content">
             <div class="mab-heading">
              Your Local Search Road Map
             </div>
             <div class="mab-subheading">
              Download your FREE report and worksheet now
             </div>
             <div class="mab-main-copy">
              <p>
               <img alt="local search roadmap" class="alignright wp-image-4632 size-thumbnail" height="150" src="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2011/10/local-search-roadmap-93x150.png" width="93"/>
               Grab your guide to local search and learn:
              </p>
              <ul>
               <li>
                What elements are important on your website
               </li>
               <li>
                How to set up your Google My Business Local Page
               </li>
               <li>
                How Google Plus can help you zoom past your competitors
               </li>
               <li>
                Two things you should not neglect if you want to rank in the local search pack
               </li>
               <li>
                How to power past your competitors and dominate your area
               </li>
              </ul>
              <p>
               Simply add your name and best email address in the box below and I'll whizz your report and worksheet straight over to you.
              </p>
             </div>
             <div class="mab-main-action-wrap ">
              <form action="http://www.aweber.com/scripts/addlead.pl" method="POST">

                </label>

       <section class="widget user-profile" id="user-profile-2">
        <div class="widget-wrap">
         <h4 class="widget-title widgettitle">
          Meet Jan Kearney
         </h4>
         <p>
          <span class="alignright">
           <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-125 photo" data-src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=125&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g" height="125" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=250&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g 2x" width="125"/>
           <noscript>
            <img alt="" class="avatar avatar-125 photo" height="125" src="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=125&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g" srcset="http://1.gravatar.com/avatar/1d50bbf3e5cfb82e047304334da9be3c?s=250&amp;d=blank&amp;r=g 2x" width="125"/>
           </noscript>
          </span>
          I believe that every business, no matter how small or how local can use the power of the web to gain more customers.  I offer no bull coaching and mentoring so small business owners can strategically put the web to work for their business.  I've been called a "compass" and a "navigator" and probably a few more names that aren't suitable for a profile!
          <br/>
          Connect with me on
          <a href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/+JanKearney">
           Google+
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="http://www.facebook.com/mylocalbusinessonline">
           Facebook
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="http://www.pinterest.com/mlbojan/">
           Pinterest
          </a>
          <a class="pagelink" href="http://www.mylocalbusinessonline.co.uk/about/">
           or Discover More About My Local Business Online
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
       </section>
       <section class="widget widget_text" id="text-13">
        <div class="widget-wrap">
         <h4 class="widget-title widgettitle">
          BizMums Widnes Host
         </h4>
         <div class="textwidget">
          <p>
           <iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="180" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/VpUt5w3osmM?rel=0" width="320">
           </iframe>
           <br/>
           <strong>
            Next BizMums Widnes Meet-up
           </strong>
           <br/>
           10am 23rd July 2015 at Crazy Club
          </p>
         </div>
        </div>

       <section class="widget widget_text" id="text-4">
        <div class="widget-wrap">
         <div class="textwidget">
          <!-- Place this tag where you want the badgev2 to render. -->
          <div class="g-page" data-href="//plus.google.com/107218782169116649399" data-layout="landscape" data-rel="publisher" data-width="250">
          </div>
          <!-- Place this tag after the last badgev2 tag. -->
          <script type="text/javascript">
           window.___gcfg = {lang: 'en-GB'};

  (function() {
    var po = document.createElement('script'); po.type = 'text/javascript'; po.async = true;
    po.src = 'https://apis.google.com/js/plusone.js';
    var s = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0]; s.parentNode.insertBefore(po, s);
  })();
          </script>
          <div id="fb-root">
          </div>
          <script>
           (function(d, s, id) {
  var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0];
  if (d.getElementById(id)) return;
  js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id;
  js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_US/sdk.js#xfbml=1&amp;appId=533109516715512&amp;version=v2.0";
  fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);
}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));
          </script>
          <div class="fb-like-box" data-colorscheme="light" data-header="false" data-height="250" data-href="https://www.facebook.com/mylocalbusinessonline" data-show-border="false" data-show-faces="true" data-stream="false" data-width="300">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </section>

       <section class="widget widget_text" id="text-6">
        <div class="widget-wrap">
         <div class="textwidget">
          <div class="hreview">
           <h2 class="item">
            <span class="fn">
             My Local Business Online
            </span>
           </h2>
           <span class="summary">
            Jan mentored us through every step of the way...
           </span>
           <blockquote class="description">
            Being novices to IT, we hired Jan through a recommendation to help us with our web site(which is brilliant). Not only did she build the web site but she as mentored us through every step of the way, navigating the internet, encouraging us to joining different social networks. With out her help we would have been really struggling to cope with the requirements of a modern day business.
           </blockquote>
           <p class="myrating">
            Rating by
            <span class="reviewer">
             Elaine Parry
            </span>
            :
            <span class="rating">
             5.0
            </span>
            stars
            <br/>
            <img alt="*" class="hreview_image" height="20" src="http://golocalonline.co.uk/images/starfull.gif" width="20"/>

   (function (tos) {
  window.setInterval(function () {
    tos = (function (t) {
      return t[0] == 50 ? (parseInt(t[1]) + 1) + ':00' : (t[1] || '0') + ':' + (parseInt(t[0]) + 10);
    })(tos.split(':').reverse());
    window.pageTracker ? pageTracker._trackEvent('Time', 'Log', tos) : _gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'Time', 'Log', tos]);
  }, 10000);
})('00');
  </script>
